org.oboedit.gui.components.treeView
Class TreeView

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  org.bbop.framework.AbstractGUIComponent
                      org.oboedit.gui.components.treeView.TreeView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, org.bbop.framework.GUIComponent
public class TreeView
extends org.bbop.framework.AbstractGUIComponent

Author:
John Day-Richter, Jennifer Deegan, and Nicolas Rodriguez.
Docs by Jennifer Deegan and Nicolas Rodriguez.

This is the main part of the component and includes the tie-ins to the configuration settings in the JavaBean TreeViewSettings.java and to the configuration panel in TreeViewConfigPanel.java.
AbstractGUIComponent docs at:
http://oboedit.org/api/bbop/org/bbop/framework/AbstractGUIComponent.html
See Also:
Serialized Form

eventQueue

protected org.bbop.swing.BackgroundEventQueue eventQueue

selectionListener

protected SelectionListener selectionListener
Listens for selection of a different term in any other component.
Enables the term selected in another component to be displayed in the Tree View. Updates the Tree View to show the newly selected terms.

historyListener

protected ReloadListener historyListener
Listens for undo or redo command that would require the Tree Viewer to reload to a different state.

Constructor Detail

TreeView

public TreeView(java.lang.String id)
Parameters:
id - The constructor inherits the id variable. A new BackgroundEventQueue is initiated. The progress bar setStringPainted boolean is set to true so that a percentage value will be displayed to show percentage of process complete on the progress bar. An actionListener is added. Addition of the startupNotifier is to get the backgroundEventThread, and the progress bar is added to this. If I move the contents of init into here then the Tree Viewer doesn't open at all any more.
Method Detail

multiTerm

protected boolean multiTerm()
Returns whether or not the component is set up to carry over multiple selection of terms from the Ontology Tree Editor.

Returns:
whether or not the component is set up to carry over multiple selection of terms from the Ontology Tree Editor.

init

public void init()
This sets up the GUI of the main display area of the component, where the tree will be shown. This is separate from the GUI of the config system, which is set up in TreeViewConfigPanel.

Specified by:
init in interface org.bbop.framework.GUIComponent
Overrides:
init in class org.bbop.framework.AbstractGUIComponent

Provides the name of the component. This doesn't seem to actually override anything.

cleanup

public void cleanup()
Removes the selectionListener and the ReconfigListener and adds the ReloadListener. Adds a reloadListener which may be to reload the display undo or redo is used.

Specified by:
cleanup in interface org.bbop.framework.GUIComponent
Overrides:
cleanup in class org.bbop.framework.AbstractGUIComponent

trimPathToNode

protected javax.swing.tree.TreePath trimPathToNode(javax.swing.tree.TreePath path,
                                                   java.lang.Object node)
Takes the full TreePath object that is the path to root, and the object listing the node(s) that have been selected and populates an object with the list of terms and relationships that are between the root and the selected node(s)

Parameters:
path - A path in a tree.
node - A node in the tree that will be used to trim the path if it is present in the path.
Returns:
The trimmed path or the original path untrimmed if the node was not part of that path.

finishUpdate

public void finishUpdate(javax.swing.tree.TreePath[] paths)
Parameters:
paths - Checks if there are any terms selected in the TreePath[] that has been passed. If there are then is sets up the progress bar to display progress on displaying the terms.

expandAll

public void expandAll(javax.swing.JTree tree)

expandToLast

public void expandToLast(javax.swing.JTree tree)

doUpdate

protected void doUpdate()
Seems to make an array of the paths from root down to each selected node, and each node in between.

update

public void update()
Validates and repaints, but may also run doUpdate depending on the state of global selection.
